#   Example MathML File: RustTestData/UEB.mmls
#   Input Braille Dir: test_data/UEB
#   Input MathML Dir: test_data/MathML
#   Instructions: You are an expert braille translator specializing in UEB braille. The user will provide a python list of strings, where each string is composed of Unicode UEB braille characters.  Here are two examples: '‚††‚†ë‚†Ä‚†®‚†Ö‚†Ä‚†ç‚†â‚†ò‚†Ü' and  '‚†é‚†ä‚†ù‚†Ä‚†∑‚†®‚†π‚†æ'. Your task is to translate each exact {braille_code} braille sequence of characters into valid MathML code. For each braille input, output ONLY the raw MathML string starting with <math> and ending with </math>. Every element in the MathML must be properly closed and nested. Do not include markdown formatting, explanations, or any other text. Do not include any newlines or carriage returns. Do not include any braille unicode characters in the MathML output. Add '|next-item|' between each MathML output. Below are some examples of braille/MathML pairs separated by '|' that should be considered the ground truth:

‚úó | ‚†∞‚†∞‚†∞‚††‚†Å‚†ê‚†£‚†≠‚†ê‚†ú‚†Ä‚†ê‚†∂‚†Ä‚†∏‚†£‚††‚†ê‚†§‚†≠‚†Ç‚†Ä‚†≠‚†Ä‚†à‚†£‚†Ä‚†º‚†ö‚††‚††‚†≠‚†Ç‚†Ä‚†≠‚†Ä‚†∏‚†à‚†ú‚†Ä‚†º‚†ö‚††‚†à‚†£‚†ç‚†ï‚†Ä‚†ô‚†Å‚†û‚†Å‚†ê‚†§‚†ç‚†ö‚†≠‚†ê‚†§‚†û‚†ë‚†≠‚†â‚†á‚†Å‚†é‚†é‚†ê‚†∂‚††‚†∂‚††‚††‚†â‚†á‚†ï‚†é‚†ë‚††‚†∂‚†Ä‚†ã‚†ë‚†ù‚†â‚†ë‚†ê‚†∂‚††‚†∂‚†û‚†ó‚†•‚†ë‚††‚†∂‚†Ä‚†é‚†û‚†ó‚†ë‚†û‚†â‚†ì‚†Ω‚†ê‚†∂‚††‚†∂‚†û‚†ó‚†•‚†ë‚††‚†∂‚†Ä‚†é‚†Ω‚†ç‚†ç‚†ë‚†û‚†ó‚†ä‚†â‚†ê‚†∂‚††‚†∂‚†û‚†ó‚†•‚†ë‚††‚†∂‚†∏‚†å‚†à‚†ú‚†∞‚†Ñ | <math><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow data-mjx-texclass="INNER"><mo data-mjx-texclass="OPEN">{</mo><mtable columnalign="left left" columnspacing="1em" rowspacing=".2em"><mtr><mtd><mrow><mo>‚àí</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>&lt;</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>‚â•</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo data-mjx-texclass="CLOSE" fence="true" stretchy="true" symmetric="true">&lt;mo data-mjx-texclass="CLOSE" fence="true" stretchy="true" symmetric="true"/&gt;</mo></mrow></mrow></math> | <math><mi>A</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo></mtd><mtd><mi>x</mi><mo>&lt;</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo></mtd><mtd><mi>x</mi><mo>&#x2265;</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>

There is no common difference.</mtext></math>
‚úó | ‚†∞‚†∞‚†∞‚††‚†Å‚†¢‚†º‚†Å‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†Å‚†¢‚†º‚†É‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†Å‚†¢‚†º‚†â‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†Å‚†¢‚†º‚†ô‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†Å‚†¢‚†º‚†ë‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚††‚††‚†º‚†ë‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†º‚†ë‚†ê‚†ñ‚†ê‚†£‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†ã‚†ê‚†ú‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†Å‚†ê‚†ñ‚†ê‚†£‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†ã‚†ê‚†ú‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†õ‚†ê‚†ñ‚†ê‚†£‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†ã‚†ê‚†ú‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†Å‚†â‚†ê‚†ñ‚†ê‚†£‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†ã‚†ê‚†ú‚††‚††‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†Å‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†õ‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†Å‚†â‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†¨‚†Ä‚†ê‚†§‚†º‚†Å‚†ä‚††‚†∞‚†Ñ ‚úó | ‚úó | ‚úó | ‚†∞‚†∞‚†∞‚††‚†ã‚†ê‚†£‚†≠‚†ê‚†ú‚†Ä‚†ê‚†∂‚†Ä‚†Å‚†≠‚†î‚†º‚†É‚†ê‚†ñ‚†É‚†≠‚†ê‚†ñ‚†â‚††‚††‚†º‚†ö‚†Ä‚†ê‚†∂‚†Ä‚†Å‚†≠‚†î‚†º‚†É‚†ê‚†ñ‚†É‚†≠‚†ê‚†ñ‚†â‚††‚†∞‚†Ñ | <math><mtable><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mo>=</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mo>=</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></math> | <math><mi>F</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>&#xA0;</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math>
